intro: Chorizema parvifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved chorizema, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is known for its succulent species adapted to arid environments. The plant features small, narrow leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is typically found in rocky soils and is well-suited to dry, sunny conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
